programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at what happened when an Ethiopian Airlines flight ran out of fuel and plunged 31,000 feet, and how the pilot attempted to save everyone onboard.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.sub-title: While I Breathe, I Trust the Cross
programme.desc: The death of the Knights Templar Order is imminent as Landry and his Templar brothers are sentenced to burn at the stake. Part-fictionalised historical drama, starring Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi's plans go awry as the buyers hit Santa Ana and Dave shows up looking to cause trouble.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene brings his father Gunter to help hunt for collectibles and Ivy takes a gamble for something out of the ordinary.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The swampers reflect on the most memorable moments of the series, recalling their greatest triumphs as well as the dangers they have faced.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Faced with storms, currents and deadly gators, the hunters risk life and limb to fill their tags. Revisit the scariest moments of the series in this special episode.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a 1920s car with wooden wheels and a ball and chain from Arizona's oldest prison.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is placed in a difficult position when a client offers him a set of Saddam Hussein's fingerprints, originally taken by the FBI.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Seth continue continue their tense stand-off, but a demanding customer forces them to band together. A signed and authenticated Elvis record stimulates interest, but Les and Rich are wary of paying too much for it.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Matters come to a head when Rich invades Ashley's territory in the jewellery and loan department.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Armed with a budget of Â£1,000, the teams scour the scrapyards in search of fast cars such as Ferraris and Porsches. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While Rick and Marty try to make sense of their finds so far, a new theory links the island to the Aztec Empire.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Investigating freak cases of mass animal deaths and trying to discover why bee and bat populations are dramatically shrinking.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine the belief that gifted children with strange abilities and great knowledge may have been born from ancient aliens.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a medal with links to Captain Cook, and a putter from the famed 1963 Frank Sinatra Invitational. Plus, Rick's stress levels hit a new high.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff examine items signed by President Franklin D Roosevelt, as well as a rare photograph taken during baseball star Babe Ruth's debut season.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: An LA auction brings more competition than the buyers were expecting, and Dave Hester returns despite his chequered history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy finds a way to lighten the mood in the hot California sun, but the bidding wars that ensue are anything but cool.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three chefs get fired up as they compete for charities near and dear to their hearts.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley hires a woman to work at the jewellery counter, without consulting with Seth or Les. Questions about Ashley's skills are raised after suspicious transactions.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les orders Seth and Rich to clean up the warehouse to make room for new merchandise. When nothing is done, the owner has doubts that his children are cut out for business.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Armed with a budget of Â£1,000, the teams scour the scrapyards in search of fast cars such as Ferraris and Porsches. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: A look at the 1974 Coyame and 2007 Xilitla UFO crash cases in Mexico, where the Mexican and US military reportedly recovered wreckage material.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts visit a cemetery in Texas said to contain the body of an alien who crash-landed on Earth in 1897.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While Rick and Marty try to make sense of their finds so far, a new theory links the island to the Aztec Empire.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Keep Your Friends Close and the Veterans Closer
programme.desc: Paul and Bogart take aim at auction veterans Cindy and Tim, while Ursula is on the lookout for items that cater to men.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy arrives at an auction in the village of Emery intent on bringing some fun to the bidding wars, but his clowning around might end up annoying fellow buyers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick auctions off some of the shop's coolest finds, while back in Vegas, Corey and Chum go off-road to check out an Ultra 4 Racecar.

programme.title: Forged in Fire Tournament of Champions
programme.desc: Four metalsmiths must harvest materials from a metal sculpture to forge their Damascus blade, before the finalists duel with Flamberge Rapiers.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Fat Lady Is Warming Up
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi look to coast through the auctions, but end up having a marathon. Darrell faces the auction without Brandon to back him up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hit the Palm Springs desert hoping for some hot profits. Mary sticks to a tight budget while Darrell is willing to spend big.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Eddie Izzard, Josh Widdicombe and Trevor Noah
programme.desc: Eddie Izzard hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of stream-of-consciousness humour before introducing routines by The Last Leg star Josh Widdicombe and South African comic Trevor Noah.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A mechanical life form named the Inquisitor's quest to eliminate worthless beings brings him aboard Red Dwarf, where he has plenty of candidates to choose from. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Canadian stand-up Katherine Ryan takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with Pointless co-presenter Richard Osman and comedian Desiree Burch joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: The return of the hospital comedy, starring Ed Easton. Simon resorts to desperate measures when Lucy tells him she's engaged to Dr McKenzie, while a new wheeler-dealer porter Anthony threatens Frankie's 'business' empire.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: When surgeon extraordinaire Mr Pradeep is put under Simon's wing for the day, disaster ensues just as a cosplaying Orc fanatic is admitted into the hospital.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Simon's first night shift coincides with Halloween and an escaped prisoner roaming the wards - will he and Frankie survive?.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Adventurers Tim and Gendle are given an epic downhill location and three days to pull off a spectacular festival of drift.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Andrew and Kevin Buckles re-imagine the game of golf as they design a course that floats on their lake.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Skilled siblings Kevin and Andrew Buckles build a much-needed workshop at their lakeside cottage.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a collection of classic cars in Colorado, including a 1961 Messerschmitt, and decide to make an offer on a prize exhibit.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are determined to land their most profitable auction to date, and Desert Dan returns.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Alvarados take a gamble and Tarrell 'T-Money' Wright lands an interesting item. Plus, Brandon Bernier hopes to make an impact on the bidding for several storage units.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects. The guys unearth ultra-rare skis for a Model T Ford as they pick one of the biggest barns they've ever seen.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Turin, Italy, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage from Mumbai of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines or brakes and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Four famous faces go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week, with comedians Nish Kumar and Al Murray, Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo and broadcaster Anneka Rice the first contestants. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the weekly scores are tallied resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday, when the victor chooses between a House of Games dartboard and a branded dressing gown.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by TV presenters Dale Winton and Richard Bacon, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes comic actress Miranda Hart and sports presenter Clare Balding. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner introduces a look back at some of the best bits from the series, plus a few hitherto unseen clips. Topics nominated for consignment to oblivion include dabbing, people who love the outdoors and The Archers.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters hit the road in a Jensen-Healey, a Lotus and a TVR as they chart the decline of the British sports car industry, on a journey from Norfolk to Blackpool. On the test track, Jeremy Clarkson enthuses about the Ferrari 458 Italia, and actor Jeff Goldblum is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond tackle the traffic chaos snowy weather causes in Britain, and hit upon a solution involving a combine harvester, some rudimentary engineering skills and a trip to Norway. Jeremy also tests the Audi RS5 and the BMW M3, and American actress and model Amber Heard is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Jessica Knappett's sunny outlook on life is severely tested by a former traffic warden, and Rhod Gilbert once again endangers Alex's life.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: The return after a mid-series break of the quiz in which four famous faces take part in a week of trivia-based games, beginning with Rachel Riley, JB Gill, Katie Derham and Richard Herring.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the light-hearted panel show, which sees comedy actress Miranda Hart, TV and radio host Reggie Yates and Countryfile presenter John Craven competing to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include stuffed marrows, spitting, the hip-hop handshake and Miranda's breasts.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees veteran broadcaster Terry Wogan, cricketer-turned-TV personality Phil Tufnell and writer, presenter and poker player Victoria Coren Mitchell compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include food packaging, health fads, the 1990s Australian cricket team, hors d'oeuvres and people who walk around changing rooms naked.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: All Girls Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: A female-only special of the comedy show, showcasing some of the funniest women to have graced the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The programme features routines by Sara Pascoe, Sarah Millican, Lucy Porter, Roisin Conaty, Katherine Ryan, Ellie Taylor, Michelle Wolf, Jen Brister, Shappi Khorsandi, Francesca Martinez, Andi Osho and Celia Pacquola.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Canadian stand-up Katherine Ryan takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with Pointless co-presenter Richard Osman and comedian Desiree Burch joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: At the halfway stage, all contestants - except Phil Wang - are in with a chance of victory. Kerry Godliman and Jessica Knappett resort to soapy violence.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A spate of petty pilfering in the hut leads to fears that one of the lads may be a thief - and prompts Oz to come up with a novel way of catching the culprit. Classic comedy, starring Kevin Whately, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: Mars is one of the best-explored places in the solar system and yet we still don't know the answer to the big question - is there or was there life on Mars?.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: Revealing how a famous photo of the Loch Ness Monster taken in 1934 took the world by storm, and examining the truth behind the image.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: A serial killer who terrorised London in 1942, using the chaos of the Blitz as an opportunity to attack women.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two episodes from Balmoral, where she takes a tour of the grounds in a 1953 land rover and views archive footage of the royal family. Valuables brought in to be viewed include a collection of medals from both World Wars presented to a man who also rescued survivors from the Titanic, an art nouveau mirror and a 16th-century bottle that survived being unearthed by a digger.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Guy Walters explores Hitler's plans for the future after the Second World War, beginning by revealing what Britain under Nazi occupation would have looked like.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitler's regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the nation with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook to discover how the railways have affected people and what remains of Bradshaw's Britain. He begins by travelling from High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, to Stratford-upon-Avon in Warwickshire, finding out about the remarkable craftsmen behind the Victorian furniture trade, discovering how George Bradshaw helped save Britain's canal heritage and seeing Shakespeare through the eyes of a 19th-century rail tourist.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo learns how the railways helped to make Birmingham the pen-making capital of the world, hears the chilling tale of one of 19th-century Britain's most notorious murderers and samples delicacies concocted in a Victorian kitchen at Shugborough Hall, Staffordshire.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: An exploration of the Harz Mountain Railway in Germany - Europe's longest rail network - which still uses steam locomotives and has a murky, hidden past.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz finds himself back in England after a night of heavy drinking - but has no idea how he got there. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A spate of petty pilfering in the hut leads to fears that one of the lads may be a thief - and prompts Oz to come up with a novel way of catching the culprit. Classic comedy, starring Kevin Whately, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's washing-machine breaks down, and Arkwright decides to try and lure her into his home with the offer of his vintage machine.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Pathologist Duncan Clark (Davood Ghadami) begins work with Burke and Reid on the case of a tortured and mutilated body found in a vacant warehouse. After identifying the victim as newly qualified doctor Scott Clarkson, they discover he may been involved in a drugs scam, but the investigation is complicated by the unexpected arrival of London cops DI Casey and DS Moretti. Glasgow-set detective drama, guest starring Reece Dinsdale (Coronation Street) and Steve John Shepherd (Plus One), with Blythe Duff, John Michie and Alex Norton.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Dalziel witnesses a shooting through a neighbour's window and rushes to the scene to find a dead woman, whose husband is suspected of being responsible for the incident. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Michael Kitchen and Josette Simon.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry celebrates his birthday at a comedy club, where a controversial act comes under fire from a group of hecklers. Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy says farewell to the Fusiliers. Complications during a live firing exercise results in a secret coming up to the surface. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: New recruit Andy Butcher is overjoyed to be going on a live-firing exercise almost straight away, but soon makes a devastating mistake. As Marsha's troubles deepen, she finds solace in a bottle and spurns all offers of help from her friends, while Williams and Phillips' relationship reaches a turning point.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Enigmatic new consultant Dan Clifford turns up at the hospital and examines the kidney transplant case, while a worried Abra covers his tracks. Elliot is forced to finally confront his demons over Gina's death and Connie reveals she is pregnant to a stunned Sam. Medical drama, with Peter Wingfield and Adrian Edmondson.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Barney treats a group of Spice Girl lookalikes, and Andrew tries to calm an irate Duffy who announced she's having the baby whether he likes it or not. Meanwhile, Holly receives another gift from her secret admirer, and suspects Patrick may be behind the offering. Starring Cathy Shipton, Philip Bretherton and Ronnie McCann.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant and Phil have a word of warning for Richard, while Ian has a surprise for Cindy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Shelley thinks that a holiday might help her relationship, but Mark has other ideas. Arthur is having car trouble, and Grant gets an unexpected visitor.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote goes metal detecting. Meanwhile, A fire that has broken out at a house ends in tragedy, and Gregg steals the show at Jaffa's talent contest.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The three doctors fall out when a consultant refuses to operate on their heart patient because he is a heavy smoker. Jack is unhappy because Beth has rejected his proposal and Will's marriage suffers another setback. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally is shocked by news of Megan's pregnancy and her mood is soured further by the discovery that Kim already knows about it. Work matters prove just as complicated when the nurses help a teenager in need of a kidney transplant whose health is further threatened by tensions between potential organ donors in her family. Guest starring Frances Barber and Stella Gonet alongside Samantha Giles, Holly Grainger and Denise Van Outen.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: An activity weekend lands Dorien in hospital - where she is mortified that the private doctors might think she fraternises with the likes of Sharon and Tracey. Veteran TV weatherman Ian McCaskill appears as himself.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey reprimands DeVere for not fulfilling his duties as lord of the manor when he fails to attend church on Sunday, but then forgets to practise what she preaches. Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo speculates why blood rushes to the head when upside down but not to the feet while standing up, so Seymour sets up an experiment to demonstrate the way the body works. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Michael Aldridge.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo pulls a piece of antique silver from the canal, and Seymour sets about recovering any other items down there, with the intention of returning them to their rightful owners.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Dalziel meets an attractive British singer during a European police conference, but wakes up to find her dead and himself accused of murder. Released on bail, he begins inquiries into the case which yield a complex story of diamond dealing and police corruption. Michael French guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The arrest of a Turkish girl who has been working illegally leads Ucos to reopen the case of Richard Gibson, a pub landlord who died in a fire in 2009. The original investigation concluded Gibson's death was probably suicide due to his dire financial situation, but the detectives have some questions about the pub's live-in barmaid, who disappeared on the night of the blaze. Could widowed landlady Joanne, pub regular Jason, or the dead man's best friend David, who happens to have a sideline in passing off his British-produced sparkling wine as French champagne, supply them with any answers? While the case tests the team's brain power, Sasha is also keen to raise their fitness levels as she signs them up for a five-a-side football competition. Phil Davis, Niamh Cusack and Tom Georgeson guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The Home Office asks Sam and her team to re-examine the work of an independent pathologist. Harry's patience is tested to the limit by the investigation. Feature-length crime drama, starring Amanda Burton, Mick Ford and William Armstrong.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of people who were abandoned as babies, helping them try to find their birth families and know their identities. David McBride was left in a car as a two-week-old infant in January 1962, while Helen Ward was left in a tartan bag in a telephone box in Dundalk in 1968.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Live interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small. Celebrity teams, led by Frank Skinner and Jonathan Ross, go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.

programme.title: Obese and Expecting
programme.desc: Documentary following four morbidly obese pregnant women as they suffer health crises and relationship breakdowns, all while striving to deliver healthy babies.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How a drug-dependent landlady killed and buried seven victims for their social security cheques. Plus, a serial murderer is convicted on the basis of DNA evidence, 12 years after committing the crime.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2015 care worker Torrance Cheeves is found stabbed to death in his Texas home. With no suspects and a trail of puzzling evidence, officers turned to CCTV footage for clues.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Claypool Hill, Virginia, where a popular pizza restaurant was turned into a horrific crime scene. The clues pointed to something more sinister than a robbery gone wrong, and authorities realised they had to move quickly to catch the killer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating the murder of a record store employee discover the crime was not motivated by money, and suspect a gang of bikers may have been involved.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The full horror of illegal dog fighting is revealed when an investigator finds a pit bull that's been shot and beaten to death. And a pack of stray cats outwits the team.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It is the turn of the Cook Islands to provide the cases, as Chris Brown handles a hit-and-run victim, a wolfhound with an eye problem and very mischievous goat called Brownie.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Meghan is angry with her maid of honour for stealing the limelight, while LaToya's choice of dress causes a wardrobe malfunction for her bridesmaid.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori reaches her limit with the most disrespectful bridesmaids she has ever met, including some who try to put the bride off her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: When E'terica's fiance questions her taste in wedding gowns, he also tests her self-esteem, while Katy's mother is not ready to let go of her daughter.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits with an eye for a bargain scour France's largest flea market, Saint Ouen in Paris, for treasures to upcycle and sell in Brighton. Marilyn turns an old screen into a changing room, Morgan makes a coffee table from parquet flooring and Emma buys an old table with a few hidden surprises.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James and Jo are taken by surprise when a bumper-car collector looking for a loan turns up at the shop offering an impromptu test drive. Patrick is star-struck when he deals with a bass guitarist known for playing with Eric Clapton, Jamo works hard to authenticate a catalogue thought to be signed by astronaut Neil Armstrong, and a young woman in financial difficulty is desperate to borrow against some paintings so she can make a fresh start.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A dead horse is found at a farm in northern Pennsylvania, where 13 other horses are living in dreadful conditions. Plus, an emaciated dog and a cat with a large tumour are treated. Documentary following the work of the SPCA's Humane Law Enforcement team, which investigates cases of animal cruelty.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Twelve investigators have police back-up on a dangerous assignment to arrest a dog breeder selling sick puppies.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into the work of toxicologists, who use blood and tissue samples to solve gruesome murder cases.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How splinters of bone helped forensic investigators to trace a murderer four years after the victim first disappeared.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary examining the case of Patti Adkins who vanished in July 2001, shortly after leaving her shift at a Honda factory in Ohio. A police investigation revealed the 29-year-old single mother was making plans for a trip with a mystery boyfriend, but he has never been identified.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 32-year-old Florida firefighter Brandy Hall, whose truck was found submerged at the bottom of a pond after she went missing in August 2006. There were traces of her blood inside the vehicle and a year later her backpack - minus her gun - was found in a canal. The FBI reviewed the evidence and decided Hall had likely been murdered, but the mystery of her fate remains.

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The actress revisits the case of well-respected doctor Autumn Klein, who after collapsing in her home. Doctors were baffled until her test results showed she had been poisoned, but it was unclear whether it was suicide or murder.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'll Know It When I See It
programme.desc: Brooke is looking for a special gown - it has to be unique and she won't settle for anything else. Unfortunately, nothing seemingly lives up to her expectations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nikasha wants to look like a grown woman on her wedding day, but her father would like her to appear the way she did on her sixteenth birthday.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Cindy and her mother hope to find a big, regal ball gown, and are surprised when her sister and best friend fly in from Miami.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kandice is worried her custom-made gown may not be all she had hoped for, while money is no object for Aleshia as she seeks the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: After losing seven stone, Stephanie wants to show off her new figure in a sexy wedding dress, while Akisha worries her outfit will not impress her fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: If You've Got It, Flaunt It
programme.desc: Embracing her height, pro-basketball player Kia looks for a long dress to complement her six-inch heels.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Sisters Diana and Jeanette seek the dad who vanished from their lives when they were young, and Heidi discovers her musical talent comes from her birth mother.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lisa's struggle with her weight began as a child and worsened after witnessing her brother's murder. Now bedridden, she is unable to care for herself.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The wives race in a cardboard boat regatta at a pirate festival in Las Vegas. Christine and Robyn's families pitch in to build the boats.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: After buying a dress she hates, Bride Kate wants to find a gown both her and her mum love. Meanwhile, Jo and Al try to help young bride Amy express her emotions.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride Zoe hands all dress-choosing-responsibility over to Jo and Al. Meanwhile, bride Emma is determined to have her dream dress for when she renews her vows.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI is alerted when a female Army officer fails to report for work and a mysterious bloodstain is found at her home. Her husband comes under suspicion of murder because of his violent history, but the investigators find little evidence to implicate him.
